intro: Lastrea hallieri, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Saint Helena. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a leathery texture. Due to its restricted habitat and conservation status, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
